forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 53. South wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 10am, then rain showers between 10am and 4pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
A blanket of rain drapes over Downtown San Francisco tonight, with droplets tapping rhythmically against the windows and the wind stirring the deeper echoes of the city. The temperature hovers in the cool embrace of the low fifties, as gusts sweep through, reminding one of the raw, wild beauty of a long winter's night. Tomorrow, the rain is set to dance with a different energy, accentuated by occasional thunderstorms. The sprawling streets, often bustling with life, might seem subdued under the weight of the clouds, casting a soft, muted light over the buildings, as the afternoon promises a gradual descent into cooler temperatures.

The fog is likely to weave itself through the corners of the skyline, painting an ethereal layer across familiar landmarks, while further hints of marine air may cling close. Given the damp and unpredictable weather, layers will be your ally—think cozy sweaters paired with water-resistant outerwear. As the day progresses, a quiet stroll through the embrace of the rain might be an ideal way to connect with the city's hidden corners, perhaps while enjoying a comforting cup of coffee at a nearby café, watching the world go by behind misty glass.
